data.title: Festivals & Events
data.meta_description: Explore the official Lubbock events calendar to find information on current and upcoming shows, festivals, and events.
data.text:
Cotton Court Sunday Funday Summer Pool Party

Get ready for an unbeatable experience at just $15 per person! Dive into Cotton Court’s Sunday Funday series, where locals and travelers alike can indulge in tantalizing refreshments, groove to the beats of a live DJ, and savor favorites from Midnight Shift’s delectable food and cocktail menu. Exclusively open to the vibrant 21 and up

Trivia Night!

Join us every Monday 7-9 for Trivia Night with your hosts, Logan and Jade! What to expect: 6 rounds (5 question rounds, 1 picture round) 1-12 people in a team Prizes for 1st and 2nd place, high five for 3rd place Win a trivia night to be entered into “The Tournament of Champions”!

Open Farm Night

Check our social media for info on the specifics of the events each week. @skygardenstx Come out to the farm on one of our You-Pick nights or mornings and enjoy a good ole-fashioned West Texas sunset while cutting your favorite flowers from our farm. We will have the clippers and a jar of fresh water

WORK WITH PURPOSE CONFERENCE

Join us for the Work with Purpose Conference by Kingdom at Work on Tuesday, August 27, 2024 at Buddy Holly Hall of Performing Arts and Sciences. During this one-day event, you’ll discover your spiritual identity, activate your faith in the marketplace, and find purpose in your work.

Work with Purpose Conference

Are you a Christian professional looking for purpose in your work? Join us for a one-day conference that will help you: – Discover your spiritual identity– Activate your faith in the marketplace– Partner with God in your work

Ballroom Dance

LHUCA is excited to have Adam Orozco as the instructor for Ballroom Dance at LHUCA! Attendees will develop skills in several styles of dance over the course of the program. Ballroom Dance is a beginner friendly session, no partner or experience needed. Sessions will take place on Wednesdays from 6- 7 p.m. Registration is $5. Register

The Band of Heathens – Live at Cactus Theater!

The Band of Heathens – Live at Cactus Theater! Thursday, August 29, 2024 Doors 6:50 pm  Showtime 7:30 pm With their ninth studio album, Simple Things, The Band of Heathens came home geographically, as they returned to their longtime base of Austin for the recording; sonically, in an embrace of the rootsy, guitar-based rock with which

Ballroom, Latin, And Country Group Class And Dance Party

Come Out To Elegance Ballroom Dance Studio And Event Center For Our Weekly Group Class And Dance Party Ever Week A Different Dance Is Taught Including But Not Limited To Cha Cha, Rumba, Swing, Salsa, Samba, Mambo, Merengue, Bachata, Cumbia, Bolero, Waltz, Tango, Foxtrot, Country 2 Step, and Country Waltz With Complementary Drinks And Hors

Mass Appeal – A Tony Award Winning Play

Step behind the pulpit and into the intriguing world of Mass Appeal, a thought-provoking play that offers an intimate glimpse into the lives of ministers, while fearlessly delving into the often overlooked struggles they face. The Tony Award-winning play by Bill C. Davis tells the story of an older, complacent priest being challenged to a

Velvet Taco Hosts ‘Party on the Patio’ Series in Lubbock, Texas

Velvet Taco will host their second annual ‘Party on the Patio’ series in Lubbock, TX as well as continue their exclusive Happy Hour Menu to in Lubbock, TX. PARTY ON THE PATIOStarting Thursday, June 8, 2023, Velvet Taco will host their second annual Party on the Patio series in Lubbock. The Thursday night event will

BBQ Lunch with Live Music & FREE Beer

Friday Lunch is a buffet that features two trips through the buffet line featuring smoked brisket, sausage, home-made chicken-n-dumplings, as well as homemade side items. FREE beer and LIVE music by a variety of artists. Visit our Facebook page to see who is playing each week. Cost is $15.00 per person every Friday from 11:30

Caldwell Entertainment presents: A Tribute to The Eagles and The Doobie Brothers

Caldwell Entertainment presents: A Tribute to The Eagles and The Doobie Brothers Friday, August 30, 2024Doors 7 pm  Showtime 7:30 Caldwell Entertainment is back with one of the best mashups ever made. These two groups took the ’70s by storm and the Caldwell Collective will be performing the masterpieces crafted by these two legendary

TTU Football vs Abilene Christian

TTU FB vs. ABILENE CHRISTIAN Event Date: Saturday, August 31, 2024 at 6:30 pm Facility: JONES AT&T STADIUM *Ticket prices are subject to change until added to the cart.

English Newsom Food & Wine Market

The Food & Wine Market is in full swing at English Newsom Cellars! Whether you have a hankering for rosé, an aromatic white, or a bold red…there is an abundance of food & wine to suit any mood. Stop by on Saturdays from 5-8.

Opening at The Wolfforth Farmers Market

We will be open to the public at the Wolfforth Farmers Market on Saturday January 25th 2020 from 10am to 2pm. Just follow the smell of hot, fresh beef, smoked corn on the cob and our signature, Moore Cajun Smokehouse original, Fais-Do-Do Chili.We will be here every Saturday, from January 25th, in Barn 3. Miss

Lubbock Live Festival For The Arts

Lubbock Live is a non-profit music and arts festival that consists of music, theater, and dance performances across 4 stages along with visual artists, vendors, and food trucks. This event lasts from 12pm-11pm located at the LHUCA and Two Docs Brewing Co. on August 31st, 2024, and is a come-and-go event. Tickets are $35 for

Mo?’s Market in the Depot District

A fun family and dog friendly event that is monthly, we have vendors, food trucks, free classes, and all the brick and mortar shops. Come enjoy live music that changes monthly, bring family friends and those cute pups for a morning of Lubbock finest!

TTU Volleyball

RED RAIDER CLASSIC DAY 1 Event Date: Thursday, September 5, 2024 at 6:00 pm Facility: United Supermarkets Arena *Ticket prices are subject to change until added to the cart.

First Friday Art Trail

Join us for First Friday Art Trail, a program of LHUCA! FFAT is a free, self-guided art tour held in the Lubbock Cultural District held in partnership with a variety of art centers, museums, galleries, and businesses. Come out for live music, food trucks, and art from local, national, and international artists! Musical performance by

Kassidy King, Brandon Gwinn, Jason

Hub City Garden Tour 2024

The Hub City Garden Tour on September 7 is an inspiring way to get ideas for gardening in west Texas. Hosted by the Lubbock Master Gardener Association (LMGA), the tour is a self-guided exploration of six Lubbock gardens on Saturday, September 7 from 1 to 6 p.m. Admittance per person is $20; kids under age

38 Special with KJ and the 27s

Proudly presented by West Texas Land Guys West Texas Hero Homes takes care of our returning military and first responders who have sacrificed so much for our freedom by providing mortgage-free homes to disabled heroes and their families in the Lubbock area. Location: The outdoor stage at Cook’s Garage Event Details: Rain or Shine: The show must

Un(wine)d with the Arts

LHUCA is happy to bring you Un(wine)d with the Arts in the LHUCA Galleries! Join us each month the Thursday after First Friday Art Trail for a stroll around the Galleries and a glass of wine! Each month will feature current exhibition, gallery tours, artist talks or meet-and-greets!

Seminar of the International Parenting and Dance Network

The International Parenting and Dance Network (IPADN) brings together renowned artists and scholars from around the world to offer a day-long seminar for the public at Texas Tech University on Friday, September 13, 2024. IPADN, which was launched by Professor of Dance, Ali Duffy, along with Aoife McGrath, Professor at Queen’s University Belfast; Lucy McCrudden,

2024 Fall Festival

The Garden and Arts Center is pleased to once again host the 54th Annual Fall Festival, a free event open to the public. This year’s festival will be held on September 14th, 2024. The Festival welcomes all artists to be a part of this year’s event as they display and sell their work, which can

TTU FB vs. NORTH TEXAS Event Date: Saturday, September 14, 2024 at 11:00 am Facility: JONES AT&T STADIUM *Ticket prices are subject to change until added to the cart.

Beginner Square Dance Classes

Square Dance is a social dance. You do not need a partner join, because you will end up dancing with everyone throughout the semester. We welcome anyone ages 12 and up. The first lesson is free. After that, it’s only $5/lesson for adults, $3 for college students, and teens are free. To sign up, simply

AVATAR: THE LAST AIRBENDER IN CONCERT audiences will immerse themselves in a two-hour special with a live orchestra bringing the show’s iconic musical score to life, in perfect harmony with highlights and favorite moments from all three seasons of the series. Taiko and erhu will share the spotlight with violins and clarinets, while the series’

Sports Card & Memorabilia Show of Lubbock

Over 100 tables of Sports Cards, Memorabilia, Pokémon, Funko Pops and many more unique collectibles. Vendors from all over the area bringing you some of the best deals. Don’t miss out!

Koe Wetzel at Cook’s Garage

Koe Wetzel & Treaty Oak Revival on the Big Stage! Join us under the stars as Koe Wetzel makes a triumphant return to the big stage, alongside the sensational Treaty Oak Revival & Kolton Moore and the Clever Few. Set for October 11th, 2024, this outdoor concert promises to be a highlight of the music

Hub City Renaissance Faire

Join us for the 2nd Hub City Renaissance Faire at LHUCA! The one-day festival titled after the program itself, Hub City Renaissance Faire, is an invitation for families to enjoy the magical space where medieval times bloom into The Renaissance and where high fantasy meets urban fantasy.

Brandon Lake at United Supermarkets Arena

GRAMMY®-Award Winning singer/songwriter Brandon Lake announces the extension of his wildly successful “Tear Off the Roof” tour with new Fall tour dates added. Featuring many fan favorite songs (“Praise You Anywhere,” “Gratitude,” “Graves Into Gardens”), unique collaborations, and brand new songs from the record-breaking album, “Coat of Many Colors,” these nights are built to inspire

Sunday, November 3, 2024Doors: 6:20  Showtime: 7:00 pm The Fear of Standing Still – Fall 2024 Album Release Tour For nearly two decades, American Aquarium have pushed toward that rare form of rock-and-roll that’s revelatory in every sense. “For us

The Buddy Holly Hall Presents: FLATLAND CAVALRY

Flatland Cavalry is breaking out into a gallop. After years of hot trotting across their native Texas, the country outfit is primed for a breakout with the release of their third full-length album, the sonically sprawling and wistfully written Welcome to Countryland.

9th Annual Veterans Parade of Lubbock

This is the 9th annual Veterans Parade to be held in Lubbock, Texas. The Veterans Parade is an event, designed to pay tribute to veterans and all who have served in Lubbock. November 11 in all states, it is usually observed on a state holiday and a federal holiday. Veterans’ Day is an annual American

SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 17, 2024 Doors | 6pm || Show | 7pm Admission from $39.50 to $79.50 Showing in the Helen Devitt Jones Theater

The Buddy Holly Hall Presents: ZZ TOP

ZZ Top is an American rock band formed in 1969 in Groves, Texas. The band has, since 1970, consisted of bassist and vocalist Dusty Hill, guitarist and lead vocalist Billy Gibbons (the band’s leader, main lyricist and musical arranger), and drummer Frank Beard. Mean Girls

Direct from Broadway, MEAN GIRLS is the hilarious hit musical from an award-winning creative team, including book writer TINA FEY (“30 Rock”), composer JEFF RICHMOND (“Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt”), lyricist NELL BENJAMIN (Legally Blonde) and original director and choreographer CASEY NICHOLAW (The Book of Mormon). Cady Heron may have grown up on an African savanna, but

LES MISÉRABLES

Performance Schedule:Tuesday, Feb. 11, 2025 – 7:30 p.m.Wednesday, Feb. 12, 2025 – 7:30 p.m.Thursday, Feb. 13, 2025 – 7:30 p.m.Friday, Feb. 14, 2025 – 7:30 p.m.Saturday, Feb. 15, 2025 – 2:00 & 7:30 p.m.Sunday, Feb. 16, 2025 – 1:00 & 6:30 p.m.

PRETTY WOMAN: THE MUSICAL

PRETTY WOMAN: THE MUSICAL, based on one of Hollywood’s most beloved romantic stories of all time, springs to life with a powerhouse creative team led by two-time Tony Award®-winning director and choreographer Jerry Mitchell (Hairspray, Kinky Boots, Legally Blonde). PRETTY WOMAN: THE MUSICAL features an original score by Grammy® winner Bryan Adams and Jim Vallance

ANNIE

Holding onto hope when times are tough can take an awful lot of determination, and sometimes, an awful lot of determination comes in a surprisingly small package. Little Orphan Annie has reminded generations of theatergoers that sunshine is always right around the corner, and now the best-loved musical of all time is set to return

CHAMPIONS OF MAGIC

“You HAVE to check them out! That was tremendous!” &Access Hollywood Live Following a decade touring the world as one of the most successful magic shows in history, the Champions Of Magic team are back with an explosive ALL NEW show featuring thrilling and mind-bending illusions. Catch this incredible show for the whole family at

CHICAGO

CHICAGO is still the one musical with everything that makes Broadway shimmy-shake: a universal tale of fame, fortune, and all that jazz, with one show-stopping song after another and the most astonishing dancing you’ve ever seen. In the whirlwind of Chicago’s Jazz Age, two of the Cook County Jail’s most notorious murderesses vaudeville star Velma

THE ADDAMS FAMILY

A comical feast that embraces the wackiness in every family, THE ADDAMS FAMILY is the magnificently macabre hit musical featuring everyone’s favorite creepy, kooky characters. Wednesday Addams, the ultimate princess of darkness, has grown up and fallen in love with a sweet, smart young man from a respectable family. A man her parents have never
